abstract: Three days after it insisted it was not up for sale, Dow Chemical has fired two executives it claims held unauthorized talks to sell the company. In a press release, Dow said Pedro Reinhard, a board member, and Romeo Kreinberg, an executive vice president, had “engaged in business activity that was highly inappropriate” and a violation of the company’s ethics code. Mr. Reinhard was Dow’s chief financial officer until late 2005.
lead_paragraph: Three days after it insisted it was not up for sale, Dow Chemical has fired two executives it claims held unauthorized talks to sell the company. In a press release, Dow said Pedro Reinhard, a board member, and Romeo Kreinberg, an executive vice president, had “engaged in business activity that was highly inappropriate” and a violation of the company’s ethics code. Mr. Reinhard was Dow’s chief financial officer until late 2005.

headline.main: Dow Fires 2 Executives for Buyout Talks

abstract: One of the two men fired by Dow Chemical on Thursday has rejected allegations that he held unauthorized talks with potential buyers of the company. “The behavior of the company is very unusual, and the accusations have absolutely no substance and are highly damaging to my reputation after 30 years of employment,” Romeo Kreinberg told The Associated Press. Mr. Kreinberg, who had been an executive vice president at Dow, was dismissed Thursday along with Pedro Reinhard, a member of Dow’s board, for holding what the company said were “highly inappropriate” talks with third parties about a possible sale of Dow Chemical.
